newsitem.title: JAPAN: TIFFE Euroyen ends down on position adjustment.
newsitem.headline: TIFFE Euroyen ends down on position adjustment.

text.p: The key December three-month Euroyen futures contract ended slightly lower on Wednesday on position adjustment sales.
Traders said a rise in Tokyo share prices triggered the sales, but added that follow-through selling was not detected.
There is strong demand for Euroyen futures on dips, and the December is likely to be stuck in range trade for the time being, a trader for a brokerage house said.
"Even if the December is sold, I expect buying to emerge at around 99.20. The December is likely to move in a range of between 99.20 to 99.30 in the near term," the trader said.
The December moved between a range of 99.24 and 99.26. Its turnover was 8,190 contracts.
The impact from a rise in share prices and the yen's weakness versus the dollar is likely to be limited unless they deviate from recent ranges, a trust bank trader said.
Unless Tokyo share prices rise above 19,000 or the dollar rises above 125.00 yen, there is likely to be only limited impact on Euroyen futures, the trust bank trader said.
